section.title: Installing and Configuring the Image Service
section.para: Install the Image service, as root:
After installing, you need to delete the sqlite database it creates, then change the configuration to point to the MySQL database.
Delete the glance.sqlite file created in the /var/lib/glance/ directory.

section.title: Configuring the Image Service database backend
section.para: Configure the backend data store. For MySQL, create a glance MySQL database and a glance MySQL user. Grant the "glance" user full access to the glance MySQL database.
Start the MySQL command line client by running:
Enter the MySQL root user's password when prompted.
To configure the MySQL database, create the glance database.
Create a MySQL user for the newly-created glance database that has full control of the database.

screen.userinput: GRANT ALL ON glance.* TO 'glance'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY '[YOUR_GLANCEDB_PASSWORD]';

section.para: Enter quit at the mysql> prompt to exit MySQL.

section.title: Edit the Glance configuration files and paste ini middleware files
section.para: Update /etc/glance/glance-api-paste.ini and configure the admin_* values under [filter:authtoken].
section.screen: [filter:authtoken] admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = glance admin_password = glance
section.para: Ensure that the glance-api pipeline section includes authtoken:
Add this to the end of /etc/glance/glance-api.conf.
Restart glance-api to pick up these changed settings.
Add this to the end of /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf.
Update /etc/glance/glance-registry-paste.ini, configure the admin_* values under [filter:authtoken]:
section.screen: [filter:authtoken] admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = glance admin_password = glance
section.para: Ensure that the glance-registry pipeline section includes authtoken:
section.screen: [pipeline:glance-registry] #pipeline = context registryapp # NOTE: use the following pipeline for keystone pipeline = authtoken auth-context context registryapp
section.para: Ensure that the /etc/glance/glance-registry.conf and /etc/glance/glance-scrubber.conf files point to the MySQL database rather than sqlite.sql_connection = mysql://glance:yourpassword@192.168.206.130/glance

note.para: Any time you change the .conf files, restart the corresponding service.

section.para: On Ubuntu 12.04, the database tables are under version control and you must do these steps on a new install to prevent the Image service from breaking possible upgrades, as root: # glance-manage version_control 0
Now you can populate or migrate the database. # glance-manage db_sync
